abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Adaptation to the Impact
            of Rapid Glacier Retreat in the Tropical Andes Project for
            Bolivia, Ecuador, and Peru were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. The
            key lessons learned are as follows:  Careful, early-planned
            partnerships with key stakeholders increases the viability
            and chances of Project success. Climate change adaptation
            requires extensive bottom-up work and community development.
            The ability of countries to increase their climate change
            resilience is directly linked to their capacity to generate
            and analyze data to assess vulnerability. Different
            implementation arrangements should be considered and
            included in the legal agreements for flexibility.
